title: Fashion Designer
address: 70 Washington Square, New York, NY 10012, USA
description: We are seeking a talented Fashion Designer to join our creative team at our Washington Square location. You will be responsible for designing innovative and stylish school uniforms that combine comfort, durability, and modern aesthetics.
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Fashion Design or related field
3+ years of experience in fashion design, preferably in uniform or childrenswear
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and 3D design software
Strong understanding of fabric properties and garment construction
Excellent communication and teamwork skills

title: Sales Representative
description: We are looking for an enthusiastic Sales Representative to promote our school uniform products at our Brooklyn Heights location. You will be responsible for building and maintaining client relationships, presenting our product line, and achieving sales targets.
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field
2+ years of sales experience, preferably in the education or fashion industry
Strong communication and negotiation skills
Knowledge of the Brooklyn area and local schools
Excellent customer service skills

title: E-commerce Specialist
description: We are seeking an experienced E-commerce Specialist to manage and optimize our online store operations from our Manhattan Central location. You will be responsible for improving the user experience, implementing marketing strategies, and increasing online sales of our school uniform products.
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field
3+ years of experience in e-commerce management
Proficiency in web analytics tools and SEO best practices
Experience with e-commerce platforms (e.g., Shopify, WooCommerce)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

title: Quality Control Inspector
description: We are looking for a detail-oriented Quality Control Inspector to ensure that our school uniforms meet the highest standards of quality at our Manhattan Central facility. You will be responsible for inspecting materials, monitoring production processes, and conducting final product checks.
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Textile Engineering, Quality Management, or related field
2+ years of experience in quality control, preferably in the garment industry
Strong knowledge of textile materials and garment construction techniques
Familiarity with quality management systems and standards
Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills
